intro: Saccolabium raraense, commonly known as the rare desert legume, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod-bearing fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant features small, clustered white or pale pink flowers that bloom during the cooler months. Its leaves are typically small and hairy, adapted to reduce water loss in dry environments. Saccolabium raraense is notable for its ecological role in stabilizing sandy soils and supporting local biodiversity.
